definition[0]: to not get something good, valuable etc because someone else gets it instead
example[0]: The deal will ensure that shareholders do not lose out financially.
example[1]: He lost out to Roy Scheider for the lead role.

definition[1]: to not get something good, when someone else does get it
example[3]: Another group who will lose out will be those on low incomes.
example[4]: British industry risks losing out on business opportunities.
example[5]: Companies that do not place a priority on customer service will lose out to those that do.
